newsitem.title: ROMANIA: Six Romanian domestic airports closed due to ice.
newsitem.headline: Six Romanian domestic airports closed due to ice.

text.p: Bad weather grounded flights at six of Romania's 17 airports on Tuesday, the Transport Ministry said.

Domestic airports, mainly in northern Romania, were closed after drizzle and frost had covered runways with thick layers of ice, said engineer Dan Barsan from the ministry's central winter department which monitors transport across Romania.
Otopeni and Baneasa international airports in Bucharest and the Timisoara international airport near the Serbian border operated normally, he said.
A sudden spell of bad weather hit Romania on Monday, with snowfalls across the country and average temperatures of minus six degrees Celsius.
